Data in Public Policy (DiPP) is a student organization at the Harris School focused on the intersection of data and public policy.

Data in Public Policy

Data in Public Policy (DIPP) is a student organization at the University of Chicago Harris School for Public Policy founded to build analytical skills and expertise among Harris students in open-source data platforms, foster a professional relationship with the data and tech community in Chicago, and to generally serve as a resource for Harris students interested in the intersection of data and public policy. Created informally in Fall 2012, DIPP launched as an official Harris Student Organization in Fall 2013.

Our Activities

Hack Harris

We host a weekly policy hack night at Harris, ideal for beginners who want to learn tools for analyzing policy data and building programs and websites. All students welcome, especially if it's your first time.

Events

We host events featuring people prominent in the data and policy fields in Chicago.

Student Externships

We pair interested policy students with local Chicago organizations that need help collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data.

Career Assistance

We organize and promote career events, alumni panels, and part-time and full-time job opportunities to help students find employment at the intersection of data and public policy, both during and after their time in school.

Newsletter

We send a weekly newsletter to the DiPP mailing list announcing DiPP events, Data in the News, Hack Harris tutorials and workshops, job opportunities, and other ways to get involved.

This is a newsletter post.

DiPP Potluck

16 September 2014

This is an event post. The date shown is the event date, not the post date.

Hack Harris potluck on Sept 24 for new students, returning students, and alums!

26 Aug 2014

If you don't want to think about how summer is ending, ignore this post. But if you like putting things on your calendar weeks in advance, make sure to note the Hack Harris beginning of the school year potluck.

It'll be on Wednesday (duh), 9/24 in Hyde Park at 6pm. We'll remind you again in a few weeks. This will be during orientation week and incoming students are invited. Alums, if you dare to return to Hyde Park, we'd very much welcome your beautiful faces, too!

Hack Harris 10 - JavaScript, and alums and friends always welcome!

25 Aug 2014

I think we set a new HaHa attendance record this past week! Thank you to all the Harris alums who joined us to learn SQL from Jonathan. And to repeat (or maybe state for the first time): Alums, friends, and frenemies are very much welcome at all Hack Harris events.

This week we'll dip our toes into JavaScript. HTML organizes web pages, CSS makes them pretty, and JS makes them interactive. Want to make fun interactive maps like this with open data? Well, you'll need to know JavaScript. So come get an intro to it this Wednesday @ 5:30 pm at 16 W. Randolph (Argo Tea).

Announcing our new website!

11 Aug 2014

Is the air a bit lighter, is gravity working a little harder, today or is it just me? Who knows, but the best way to deal with summer's halfway point and the existential dread that comes with it is to be productive at this week's Hack Harris! Come learn more Python, and if you're lucky maybe you'll be there when Sarah coins a new data-related pun :)

Optional things to do before Wednesday: * Install IPython Notebook * Check out some beginner tutorials
